resources.string: Acquire {itemName}
Craft {itemName} at your camp
Defeat {targetName}
Destroy {targetName}
Defeat {targetName} for {itemName} at {POITags}
Search chests for {itemName} at {POITags}
Holding item to transport
Travel to {POITags}
Well, you don't look like one of the Drowned. There's life in you, yet.\n\nAboard a ship during that storm, were you? You're fortunate to be alive, but such is the magic of this place - Aeternum.
"Aeternum? Is that where we are?"

Indeed, and it is where we will remain. One can evade death for centuries on this island, but leaving is difficult, if not impossible. \n\nI am Watcher Tahir Fayed, from the nearby settlement of Windsward. And you are…?
"I'm {playerName}."
It is nice to make your acquaintance, {PlayerName}. \n\nAs desperate as your situation may seem, almost everyone here arrived under similar circumstances.
Among the Drowned
"What happened to the crew?"
Ah, well, you see… you seem to have died and been resurrected unharmed.\n\nIt appears the rest of your crew came back without their souls, they wander the beach now as the restless 'Drowned'.
"Can anything be done for them?"

Yes, the merciful thing is to at least attempt to put them to rest. That is part of the reason I am here.\n\nIt would be better if you could do it, however, {playerName}. I need to stay here for others like you.
Defeat the Drowned if you can. \n\nIt's difficult to say whether they will remain dead, but we will know we tried, at least.
Defeat the Drowned gathered at the Mesnard's Might Shipwreck and try to put them to rest. Report back to Watcher Fayed at the Windsward Watchtower when your task is complete.
There, now. I hope that wasn't too difficult. Some have trouble confronting the soulless ones.\n\nThey're a reminder of the fate that could await us all on this island.
Open the Map (default: [M])
Investigate the Shipwreck marked on your map
Defeat {targetName}
Provide for Yourself

Of course. I imagine you are quite famished after your ordeal at sea.\n\nI did not bring any rations with me, but you can provide for yourself. Gather flint and wood and fashion yourself a skinning knife, for starters.
"Where do I find flint and wood?"
Wood's easy enough to gather from bushes around here. Flint? Those are rocks on the beach that everyone trips over.\n\nGather some of each, then use the campfire to craft a Skinning Knife.
Gather Flint and Wood, then craft a Flint Skinning Knife at Watcher Fayed's campfire. Talk to Watcher Fayed when your task is complete.
Well done, my friend. It may not be a handsome implement, but it will get the job done.\n\nNext, you will want go on a little boar hunt.
Gather supplies to craft a Skinning Knife.
Gather {itemName} from the ground
Gather {itemName} from a nearby Bush
Craft a {itemName} at Watcher Fayed's campfire
Campfire Feast
You've been at sail for some time. How does a boar steak sound?\n\nTake down one of the Boars in the brush behind me, and put your new Knife to the test. Then cook yourself a little campfire feast.
"Sounds good to me."
Careful. Those boars can put up quite a fight.\n\nI can assure you that your reward will be a fine meal, however.
Nicely done, {PlayerName}. It may seem simple enough, but both boar hunting and preparing your own food are important skills to have here in Aeternum.\n\nA full belly goes a long way.
Hunt down a boar near the Watchtower, skin it for meat, then cook a light ration at the Watcher's campfire. Talk to Watcher Fayed when your task is complete.
Hunt down a {targetName} for a meal
Equip a Skinning Knife
Skin Boar to Collect {itemName}
Cook a Light Ration from the Recovery Foods category at Watcher Fayed's Campfire
All That Remains
"What else do we need to do?"

Your ship was just one of several claimed by Corruption this day.\n\nThe Windsward settlement keeps track of all wrecks on this shore. I was hoping you could help collect records from whatever remains of these ships.
I know from personal experience that one's first few days here on Aeternum are confusing.\n\nYou will get used to it. You must adapt, or you will end up like one of the Lost, the Drowned.
Ah, well done. These records serve as both an archive and a memorial of sorts.\n\nIt's one way the people of Windsward can still keep a connection to the old world.
Search shipwrecks near the Windsward Watchtower for any records and watch out for signs of Corruption. Talk to Watcher Fayed when your task is complete.
Search Shipwrecks for Records and Remnants
From the Crown of Corpora:
Collect Ship's Manifest
Collect Ship's Roster
Collect Ship's Log
Search Ship's Locker at wreck of {POITags}
From The Satisfaction:
Collect the {itemName} from the Stern
Collect the {itemName} from the Bow
Investigate the {POITags}
Search for the source of the Corruption
Defeat the {targetName}
Remnant of Doom
"Is there anything we can do?"
We must try. If some poor wretch nearby has fallen to Corruption, it will spread rapidly.\n\nThe Corrupted would likely be at the settlement walls within a matter of days. We cannot permit that.
"I can hunt down the Corruption."
I hoped you might volunteer, though I have some misgivings about sending a new arrival. \n\nI suspect the Corruption may be lingering in the nearby sea cave. Check there, but be cautious.
Check for any lingering Corruption in the sea cave, but be careful.\n\nI will remain here to help these other survivors coming ashore.
Search Torrentdawn Cave and destroy any remnant of Corruption that remains. Talk to Watcher Fayed at the Windsward Watchtower when your task is complete.
Well now, someone has proven themselves quite capable this day.\n\nTo face down Corruption and survive without falling to Corruption oneself is quite a feat.
Watcher's Report
"Is there anything else we can do?"
Only to prepare for the day when it returns once again.\n\nThe great storm preceding your arrival was a sign that conditions will soon get worse. The Windsward settlement must be warned.
"I can take the warning."

Yes, and take a well-deserved rest at the inn as well, I hope. \n\nGo west to the settlement and give this message to Constable Dauti - he knows to expect it. Oh, and {playerName}, thank you for your assistance.
I'll remain here and help any other survivors who come ashore.\n\nTake the message to Constable Dauti, and good luck, my friend.
Travel to the Windsward Settlement and take Watcher Fayed's message to Constable Dauti.

Greetings and well met, traveler! You look to be healthy and fresh - we're glad to have you.\n\nHave yourself a pint of mead at the tavern! Have two! Windsward is a bountiful territory and you are welcome here!
"I have a message from Watcher Fayed."
Oh bother, I knew this was coming to cast a pall over the day. Very well, let's see it.\n\nYes, yes, the Corruption's getting worse, we're all doomed, etcetera, etcetera. It's never good news, is it?
Inform the Magistrate
"What old fool?"
Some old hermit - came through here decades ago, raving about Corruption. Guess he knew something.\n\nHeard he went toward Monarch's Bluffs. Keep an eye out for him if you're ever off that way.
"What's the immediate concern?"

Yes, the Shattered Mountain… luckily it's across the island, but it clearly means Corruption is spreading.\n\nWatcher Fayed's report only reinforces that. I trust you are the {playerName} he mentions here?
"Yes, that's me."

You're quite a hero by Tahir's account. So let the Corruption come, I say! We'll eat it for lunch!\n\nMake yourself at home in Windsward, my new friend. Take this message to Magistrate Korrapati, and then knock one back in the tavern! You've earned it!
Share the message with Magistrate Korrapati and then get yourself situated.\n\nYou'll want to be fully-rested when the Corruption comes!
Take Watcher Fayed's message to Magistrate Korrapati in the Windsward Settlement.
Hello there, and welcome to Windsward. We are always pleased to welcome a guest, or even a new resident. \n\nI see that message in your hand - is that the report from Watcher Fayed?
"That's correct."
I'm just grateful to know Tahir is alright. I hope he returns soon.\n\nSo Constable Dauti has seen this report, then? I imagine he'll be oiling his armor, ready to charge into battle right away.
Checking In
"What can I do to help?"
Plenty, I'm sure, but for the moment, you should take care of yourself. You must be exhausted. \n\nGo and check in at the inn, explore the town. Whenever you're ready, I'll be here.
Visit the Inn and speak with Innkeep Suen to check in.
Check in at the inn and make yourself comfortable. As I said, we are in no rush.
Speak with Innkeep Suen and bind yourself to the Settlement. Talk to Magistrate Korrapati when your task is complete.
Ah, {playerName}, that was much faster than I expected.\n\nDon't even try to tell me you actually rested. But you're an adult - you can decide when and where to make yourself at home.
The Marketplace
"What do I need to know?"
I would suggest you start by visiting the trading post.\n\nThen check out the storage space I've made available for you as well. After that, I suppose we'll put you to work!
The Trading Post is just there and the Storage Shed is nearby as well. \n\nI would encourage you to take full advantage.
Open the Trading Post
Open a Storage Shed
Well now, that was easy enough, wasn't it?\n\nFeel free to store anything you like here in Windsward. We will keep it safe. We always welcome any trading goods as well.
Visit the Trading Post and one of the Storage Sheds in the Windsward Settlement. Talk to Magistrate Korrapati when your task is complete.
Constable's New Friend
"What are his plans?"

I strongly suspect that it will have something to do with drinking or preparing for battle.\n\nHe's asked to see you. I would ask you to try to keep him in line, but I think it would be a wasted effort.
Have you spoken with Constable Dauti yet? I'm certain he'll have some work for you to do, which will help with the local infrastructure... which will help with the economy! It's all interconnected.
Speak with Constable Dauti in the Windsward Settlement.
{playerName}, there you are! It's time for us to get to work my friend.\n\nThe Windsward settlement won't defend itself, you know! And you and I - we're going to make a great team.
Preparing for Siege
"Where do we start?"

That's the spirit! Let's start with raw materials - wood, stone, and rawhide.\n\nGather what you can and then get it all refined at one of our workshops. It's good, honest work - I wish I could go with you!
Gather the resources and get them refined. Perhaps after that, we'll go to the tavern for a cup of mead!
Gather and refine the materials requested by Constable Dauti
Now then, we're starting to really stock up on some supplies here, aren't we?\n\nYou can never have too much, I say. And that goes for everything! Ha!
Gather {itemName} by Mining Boulders
Gather {itemName} by Skinning Boars and Wolves
Gather {itemName} by Chopping Down Trees
Craft {itemName} at Woodshop
Craft {itemName} at Stonecutting Table
Craft {itemName} at Tannery
Fire up the Forges!
"What about weapons and armor?"

See now there's a true warrior! Building supplies are one thing, but steel and leather, blades and plate, that's the real deal.\n\nYes indeed, my friend, we should get Artificer Cotheran to fire up the forges straightaway!
"Should I go see the Artificer?"
Perfect, perfect! Sandris is one of the finest smiths in all Aeternum.\n\nI'm sure the two of you will get along smashingly. Get those forges fired up! Haha!
Talk to Sandris - he'll be milling about down there by the forge if he's not already hard at work, I'm sure!
Speak to Artificer Cotheran in the Windsward Settlement.

Hello there, you must be this new 'hero' Dauti's been talking about. He cannot stop talking about you, and I mean that quite literally.\n\nAt any rate, he said he'd send you my way, and well, here you are.
Keeping it Simple
"You enjoy doing the work?"
I do. I am also familiar with the Constable's grandiose plans.\n\nI suspect he told you to come down and tell me to 'Fire up the Forge!' Did he?
"Yes, that's exactly what he said."

Yes, he says it quite frequently, apparently oblivious to the fact I always keep the fires lit.\n\nAt any rate, what say we start simple - try your hand at forging just an iron sword. I'll give you the ore.
Open the satchel of ore I gave you, smelt it, and then hammer out an Iron Sword. Simple enough, I think.
Craft an Iron Longsword at the Forge. Talk to Artificer Cotheran at the Windsward Settlement when you have completed your task.
Alright, let's see your handiwork here… impressive. Quite impressive.\n\nEither you've done this before, or you've got quite a knack for it.
Gather Iron Ore
Craft {itemName}s at the Smelter
Craft an Iron Longsword at the Forge
Survivalist Karsattin
"Thank you."
Before you go wandering off, you should meet Survivalist Karsattin.\n\nWhile dying isn't necessarily permanent on Aeternum, it can be quite painful. She can offer insight on avoiding it.
"What kind of insights?"
Oh the kind that keep you from freezing or starving to death out in the wilds. \n\nBeing alive and frozen solid is particularly unpleasant. Talk to Karsattin - it's rare that she's actually here.
If you're feeling shy, I understand completely.\n\nBut you shouldn't - it's not like she bites or anything, at least not that I've seen.
Uh-oh, here comes another tourist.\n\nI'm just about over everyone in this settlement expecting me to keep them safe. It's not my job.
Talk to Survivalist Karsattin in the Windsward Settlement.
Survival Tips
"So no survival tips?"
With all this talk about Corruption spreading, it sounds to me like being safe is a thing of the past.\n\nI mean, what'll you do if this settlement gets overrun by Corrupted?
"Run for the hills, I guess."

And then you'll really be in the thick of it! I mean, maybe you got what it takes, maybe not.\n\nFine, let's find out. How about you head out there, make camp, and do some hunting at some of the local wolf dens.
Defeat {targetName} to collect {itemName}
Make camp to set a respawn point in the wild (default: [Y])
Here's one tip for you, since you seem to be hesitating - make your camp in a smart spot and you'll save yourself a lot of hassle.\n\nOh, and when you hunt wolves - use a weapon…
Well now, someone's strutting in here like they've proven something.\n\nI guess maybe you're a survivor after all.
Make camp in the wilds to set a respawn point. Then face down the wolves in Dankfur Hollow and Inkwell Cave. Talk to Survivalist Karsattin in Windsward Settlement when your task is complete.
Collect musk from the wolves of {POITags}
Slay {targetName} for {itemName}
Continue to {POITags} in search of the finest of furs
(Optional) Place the musk to lure out the Alpha of Dankfur Hollow
Slay {targetName}
Survive the wolves' assault and claim {itemName} from {targetName}
Place the musk to lure the alpha
Hold out against the guardians of Dankfur Hollow
Intermission
Defeat the Dankfur Patriarch
Official Business
"Sounds smart. Thank you."
Ah well, I got plenty to share, maybe when I trust you more.\n\nMeantime, Magistrate Korrapati was looking for you - you should go see what she wants. Oh, and hey - watch your back out there.
Hey. When you talk to Korrapati, tell her I'm not her messenger, okay?
Speak with Magistrate Korrapati in the Windsward Settlement.
Well, {playerName}, it seems you've been getting acquainted with some of the settlement's more colorful characters.\n\nI hope no one's gone so far as to be offensive.
New Alliances
"Why is he making you impatient?"
Miklos has only been here a few years. He's still got that old world, cavalier attitude about things.\n\nYou seem more reasonable, however. Perhaps you could help me with something.
"Of course. What do you need?"

If we mean to defend the settlement, we must acknowledge that the factions are our best bet.\n\nYou should speak with the Marauders, the Covenant, and the Syndicate, and decide with whom you'd like to cast your lot.
Speak with the Marauders
Speak with the Syndicate
Speak with the Covenant
Consult with the Magistrate
Speak with all three Faction representatives
Perfect timing. I do hope you have spoken with the faction representatives. \n\nI'm interested to hear which of them has earned your allegiance.
Meet with each of the three factions and decide which you have the most trust in.
Meet with each faction's representative in the Windsward Settlement to decide which faction you wish to join.
Marauder Initiation: Cooper's Ranch
"What mission?"
Aeternum is a land full of riches and rewards, awaiting those hardy enough to claim them.\n\nCooper's Ranch has been overrun by the Brokebarrel Withered, forcing families to resettle elsewhere.
"You want to take it back?"

Not necessarily, but we should settle the score with the Brokebarrel, and lay claim to their spoils!\n\nYour vengeance won’t restore what those families have lost, but it will demonstrate your character.
Defeat {targetName} Withered
Collect {itemName}
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}

What are you waiting for? Go to Cooper's Ranch. We do not accept those without the strength to seize the moment and squeeze every drop of profit from it, or those who would withhold their aid in times of trouble.
Prove your worth to the Marauders by eliminating Withered at Cooper's Ranch. Return what treasure you recover to Commander Joshi in the Windsward Settlement.
Well done! I trust you left a swath of destruction in your path? Parfaite!\n\nYou have chosen wisely by joining the Marauders. We will show you the path to your destiny.
Defeat {targetName}
Syndicate Initiation: Kannan Tomb
"What kind of work?"
The kind that deals in long-buried secrets, and the madness that comes over those who have lost their souls. \n\nWe seek to understand the Dirtclaw Withered.
"What do you want to know?"

We want to know why the Dirtclaw Withered have been looting the old Kannan Tomb.\n\nThey've been doing so obsessively and hoarding stones and crystals they've recovered. Bring some of these artifacts back for us to examine.
Collect {itemName}
Collect {itemName}s from {targetName}
You're wasting valuable time talking to me.\n\nRetrieve whatever the Dirtclaws have been hoarding up at Kannan Tomb.
Explore Kannan Tomb and retrieve stones and crystals for Alchemist Jansz. Return to her in Windsward Settlement when your task is complete.
Well done, Initiate. I had a feeling you'd come through.\n\nAnd indeed, these stones are similar to lithomancy stones, and the shards… we shall have to investigate further.
"No answers for now?"
Not yet, but in time. You have already proven yourself worthy of joining the Syndicate.\n\nNow, you must learn that patience is a requirement as well.
Covenant Initiation: Merrill's Place
"I swear to do so, always."
In normal times, the Covenant's charge is to defend humanity from the Lost. We carry the Spark into dark places. \n\nBut these are not normal times.
"What do you mean?"
In this place, the Corrupted have become the greatest threat.\n\nA farm to the west has fallen to this evil. Go there, smite the Corrupted, and recover our ritual supplies.
Defeat {targetName} Corrupted
Collect {itemName}
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
Are you having trouble with the Corrupted of Merrill's Place? Fear not, for I will pray for you. I’m very good at it.
Well done, novice. Destroying the Corrupted is always a worthy cause. \n\nThe ore you recovered is steeped in corruption, but the oil is untainted! Truly, a miracle!
"Why is that?"
The mysteries of the Spark never cease, my friend, but one thing is clear - your destiny lies with the Covenant. \n\nKeep faith, and farewell.
Cleanse Merrill's Place of the Corrupted. Bring back the Covenant's ritual supplies to Adjudicator Dempster in the Windsward Settlement.
Choose Your Allegiance
[BLANK]
Join the Marauders\n OR
Join the Syndicate\n OR
Join the Covenant
I cannot make this decision for you.
Very well. Only time will tell whether you've made the right choice.\n\nBut I'm of no mind to judge. The settlement needs assistance from whichever faction will give it.
Decide which Faction you wish to join, and then speak to the appropriate Faction Representative to enlist.
Commitment to the Cause
Return to Magistrate Korrapati in the Windsward Settlement and inform her that the Marauders will defend the settlement.
"What about the Corruption?"

Mas é claro! Defenderemos este assentamento contra qualquer ameaça, seja de outras facções, seja da própria Corrupção.\n\nEu sei que as autoridades locais estão muito ansiosas, então, realmente, você pode ser a pessoa que vai tranquilizar a Magistrada.
Diga à Magistrada que ela pode contar com o apoio dos Saqueadores, aconteça o que acontecer.
"What about the Corruption?"

Supondo que possamos garantir nossas operações aqui, certamente defenderemos o assentamento de qualquer ameaça que surgir.\n\nEntendo que as autoridades locais estão muito ansiosas, então vá em frente e tranquilize a Magistrada.
Diga à Magistrada que ela pode contar com o Sindicato para garantir que tudo no Assentamento permaneça seguro e em ordem.
"What about the Corruption?"

Sua fé cede tão rápido assim? A defesa deste assentamento é primordial, seja contra a ameaça de outras facções, seja contra a própria Corrupção.\n\nEu sei que as autoridades locais têm suas dúvidas, então sim, você pode tranquilizar a Magistrada.
Diga à Magistrada que ela pode contar com a Aliança para defender este lugar, aconteça o que acontecer.
I've been hearing good things about you and your new allies. \n\nI believe you chose well in your allegiance.
Encroaching Corruption
Scour the areas near the Windsward Settlement and destroy any Corruption nodules you find. Then report back to Magistrate Korrapati in the Settlement.
"Is there anything else we can do?"

There is one matter that needs attention. Watcher Fayed is still away, so you're my best option.\n\nWe've been getting rather disturbing reports that Corruption is manifesting closer and closer to the settlement.
"I can check it out."

Thank you. Constable Dauti would send an army, but I think some discretion is appropriate here.\n\nLook for any Corruption growths in the area, and if you find them, do whatever you can to destroy them.
I appreciate you stepping up to carry out Watcher Fayed's duties while he's away.\n\nSeek out any Corruption near the settlement and for all of our sakes, destroy it quickly.
When I heard that the Shattered Mountain was erupting again, I knew it meant trouble.\n\nI didn't think we'd be under direct assault so soon, however. Did you spot any Corruption out there?
"Yes, but I destroyed it."
Well, that's a relief, I suppose. Though it would've been better had you found none at all.\n\nI think we may need to start searching for a better strategy sooner rather than later.
Search the listed areas and eliminate any signs of Corruption:
Overlooking the South Pond
Within the Grenville Forest
Near the Kannan Tomb
"How do I advance in rank?"

Sabia que tinha visto aquela centelha de ambição. Você realmente faz parte dos Saqueadores.\n\nTem vontade de chegar ao nível de um Gladiador? Complete missões para ganhar reputação e poder enfrentar a Prova do Gladiador em Ilhéus do Sabre.
"How do I advance in rank?"

Não há atalhos no Sindicato. Você levará tempo e esforço considerável para avançar. \n\nPara se tornar Escrivão, você completará missões para ganhar reputação e poder enfrentar a Prova do Escrivão em Bosque Reluzente.
"How do I advance in rank?"

Será preciso muito coração e muita coragem se você quiser avançar na ordem.\n\nPara se tornar um Cavaleiro Templário, você precisará completar missões para ganhar reputação, depois enfrentar a Prova do Cavaleiro Templário em Bosque Reluzente.
The Corruption "Expert"
Search for an old man along the river in Monarch's Bluffs. He may know more about fighting Corruption.
"Where would we find them?"

Tem um velho que mora perto do rio em Falésias do Monarca. Pelo visto ele é especialista em Corrupção. Gostaria que você fosse atrás dele. \n\nFale com o Estalajadeiro antes de ir, ele também precisa de um favor por aquela área.
I'm certainly flattered by your attention. But I really do think you're better off talking to that Hermit.
Complete Quests to Help the Settlement before Investigating Rumors
(Optional) Use Your Map to Fast Travel to the Spirit Shrine
Search for the Mysterious Old Man in {POITags}
Between Innkeeps
"I get out quite often."
Fantastic! I've run up a little debt with Innkeep Kamau up in Everfall - she loaned me some azoth.\n\nIf you'll go tell her the azoth is coming soon, she'll pay the cost for you to fast travel back.
"Fast travel back?"
Well, yes. It just costs a little azoth… like everything else, right?\n\nBut yes, if you'll give her my message and return, I'll give you a little azoth myself.
Hello there. Welcome to Everfall! Hold on, do I know you?\n\nOr have you come from Windsward? Innkeep Suen sent you, didn't he?
"Yes, he'll send your azoth soon."
I should hope so! I heard he's had an influx of new arrivals lately.\n\nCheapskate probably didn't even give you azoth to fast travel back, did he? I certainly will.
I do appreciate you delivering my message to Innkeep Kamau.\n\nI'm sure she'll give you enough azoth to fast travel back.
Inform Innkeep Kamau in Everfall that Innkeep Suen will repay her azoth soon. Speak to Innkeep Suen in the Windsward Settlement when your task is complete.
Fast Travel Home
[BLANK]
Open the Map and (optional) Fast Travel back to Windsward
Well now, that was quicker than I expected.\n\nI hope it went alright. She wasn't too frustrated with me, was she?
"She wasn't happy."

Of course not, but perhaps no more angry letters coming my way.\n\nThank you for going all the way out there, {playerName}. As promised, here's a little more azoth. Oh, and you can keep your free room!
[BLANK}
Open your map and use the azoth from the Innkeep to fast travel back to Windsward Settlement and speak to Innkeep Suen.
No Confidence Stew
"Why are you having doubts?"
Well, I'm just thinking back. You don't know all the history - but for some reason, Windsward always gets the shaft.\n\nAnd besides I have no confidence in Dauti, none whatsoever!
"You think he's making bad decisions?"
He spends half his time in here drinking, the other half dreaming or boasting.\n\nMostly, he seems interested in helping the other settlements… showing off!
"What about Magistrate Korrapati?"

She's alright. Lonely, tired, we all are. What we all need right now is a hearty meal - a delicious stew!\n\nIn fact, maybe you could go and rustle up some game? Some briar branches also - for a hot fire.
Rabbit and Turkey sound good. Briar branches for the fire, and we'll have us a solid meal.
Obtain Briar Branches, Skinned Rabbits, and Plucked Turkeys for a hearty stew. Return the ingredients to Barkeep Cormack in the Windsward Settlement.
{itemName}s
{itemName}
Ah, there's the ingredients I need. One delicious stew - coming right up! \n\nAnd you my friend, you can have the first taste. I mean it.
To the Rescue
"Of course I am!"

That's good to hear, my friend! I've learned of great misfortune that's befallen our neighbors in Monarch's Bluffs.\n\nOne of their scouting patrols came under attack out by Bullrush Wash. The situation is dire.
"You want me to help them?"
Yes, I want you to come to their rescue! Save the poor bastards on behalf of Windsward.\n\nWhatever we can do to earn allies, is worth doing. Tell them we'll always be there when they need us.
Destroy {targetName}s around {POITags}
Search for the Missing Patrol at {POITags}
Read "Fickle Fortune" at {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
Bullrush Wash is a notoriously difficult river crossing. No idea what the fools were doing out there, but we'll rescue them nonetheless.
Travel to Bullrush Wash and uncover the fate of the missing patrol. Return to Constable Dauti in the Windsward Settlement when you have completed your task.
So the patrol from Monarch's Bluffs had already been wiped out by the time you arrived?\n\nThe poor sots have probably joined the ranks of the Lost now.
Great Expectations
"We should explore other options."
My thoughts exactly. I have a theory - I just need help testing it out.\n\nI've been thinking what if there's a relationship between the Corrupted and the Lost?
"That's an interesting idea."

I have an experiment in mind, but to test it, I need soil samples from locations overrun by each.\n\nMerrill's Place for the Corrupted and Cooper's Place for the Lost, the Withered. Get me the soil samples and we just might learn something.
In Cooper's Ranch:
In Merrill's Place:
Dig up {itemName}
Dig up {itemName}
Read "Hidden Treasures"
Read "Noble Fools"
Read "Protection from Evil"
Science waits for no one, yet I shall do my best to wait for your return.
Recover soil samples from Cooper's Ranch and Merrill's Place. Return them to Artificer Cotheran in the Windsward Settlement to aid his research.
Oh, wonderful, wonderful! These samples will do nicely. Now, let me see...\n\nHmm. I expected to find certain similarities, but they're simply not there. Puzzling.
"What about the differences?"
The differences, you say? Now that is an interesting idea…\n\nYou're very insightful, you know that? I'll have to look into this… the differences. Hm.
Predator, Prey
"What do you need help with?"
Oh, it's not that I need help. It's the poor excuse for hunters around here.\n\nThey need elk antlers from the Eldergate area, but some pumas scared them off.
"You want me to gather antlers?"

I mean, sure. If you want to volunteer, I won't complain. I'm sick of coming to the rescue every time.\n\nGet the elk antlers and hunt down some of the pumas too. Then next time, they can get their own.
Travel to the Eldergate region to begin your hunt
Hunt {targetName}s in Eldergate
Collect {itemName} from Woodland Stags in Eldergate
Great little pond up there, nice place to sit and relax... I mean, as long as the pumas aren't after you.\n\nOh, and there's a mean Bear in that area, as well. I suggest you avoid pissing him off.
Complete the hunters' task to obtain Elk Antlers, and cull the Valley Puma population in Eldergate. Return to Survivalist Karsattin in the Windsward Settlement when your tasks are done.
Look at that, will you? My new best friend coming through with the elk antlers.\n\nAnd you hunted some of the pumas too? I'm impressed. You're not pathetic like these others.
Second Course
"Like what?"
A second course. Like corn for instance, and fish… oh, and strawberries for dessert!\n\nDon't know if you heard, but our crops have all been spoiled lately.
"Spoiled crops?"

Yep. So I had ordered shipments of corn and strawberries to come in, but they got waylaid out by Moe's Farm.\n\nGet that produce from the farm and some Fish from the Fish Traps in Forellac, then we'll bring up everyone's spirits!
Travel to Moe's Farm and recover the abandoned Corn and Strawberries
Collect {itemName} from containers at {POITags}
Defeat the {targetName} at {POITags}
Continue on to Forellac to collect Fresh Forellac Trout
Collect {itemName} from Fish Traps
Defeat {targetName} at {POITags}
The produce is probably strewn about in Moe's Farm, and then the Fish out in the traps in Forellac. They'll feed an army!
Retrieve Crates of Corn and Baskets of Strawberries from Moe's Farm and collect Fish from Fish Traps in Forellac. Return to Barkeep Cormack in the Windsward Settlement when your tasks are complete.
Holy piles of food, friend! You got everything on the list!\n\nI don't know if you're in it for a good meal or a rich reward, but you deserve both. That's for sure.
Windsward Envoy
"I could go talk to them."
That would be wise - you can act as our envoy. I think First Light might be open to such a discussion.\n\nIn fact, there is a gift we might bring as a token of our intentions.
"What kind of gift?"
Well, I've heard that First Light is in need of stone blocks.\n\nGather them, buy them, steal them for all I care. But if you bring the stone blocks to Constable Oakes, It's a good start, at least.
Acquire or Craft {itemName}s for Constable Oakes
I am not sure why she may need the blocks, but it must be for something important. \n\nThe settlement of First Light is quite some distance to the south, so be prepared.
Acquire and deliver 50 Stone Blocks to Constable Oakes in the First Light settlement.
Oh, well, hello you! Are you the envoy from Windsward then? And you bring us stone blocks to boot?\n\nWhat a pleasant surprise! Color me grateful, and even flattered, I think.
"Perhaps we could discuss an alliance?"

Unfortunately, this is not the time. We have matters to straighten out internally here.\n\nWhen we're ready, however, I would like for YOU to be the one with whom I negotiate. I won't forget this gesture.
Warp and Weft
"Should I go check on him?"
Oh, no, there's no time for personal matters. We have supply shortages here in Windsward - food, clothing, and metals.\n\nI can't solve them all, but I do have an idea for the clothing.
"Is it something I can help with?"

Quite so. There were two villages just over in First Light that were once famous for their weavers - Campbell's Rest and Clearwater Bend. \n\nIf you happen by there, please see if any thread or textiles remain that we can use.
In Campbell's Rest:
In Clearwater Bend:
Collect {itemName}
Read 'Threading Draft'
Retrieve {itemName} from {targetName} Withered
Read 'A Common Thread'
Windsward has always relied on trade for some supplies.\n\nI only hope we can solve this clothing shortage with materials from Campbell's Rest and Clearwater Bend.
Search the villages of Campbell's Rest and Clearwater Bend for any salvageable supplies of thread and textiles. Talk to Magistrate Korrapati in the Windsward Settlement when the task is complete.
There you are! Still no sign of Watcher Fayed, but I am glad to see you.\n\nAnd you found thread and textiles? Fantastic! This solves at least one of our supply problems.
Taste for Revenge
"Are you buttering me up?"
I suppose, but it doesn't mean I'm not being sincere. Seriously, you're my favorite person!\n\nAnd this time, it's an opportunity to get a taste of spice… and some good old-fashioned revenge.
"What does that mean?"

Well, I caught wind of a shipment of dried herbs and spices - but the caravan got nailed by the Lost Pirates of Buccaneer Falls.\n\nHow about avenging that caravan and reclaiming those spices? It'll be tasty! C'mon!
Travel to the area around Buccaneer Creek and locate the missing spices
Defeat {targetName} Pirates
Read "Of Spice and Dice" at {POITags}
Collect {itemName}
Collect {itemName}
Collect {itemName}
Nice, nice, nice. I can smell that spice from here. It'll go perfect with the fish! \n\nThe Corrupted may come and lay siege to Windsward, but we'll be hunkered down in here, eating like kings!
I need those Spices from the Lost Pirates in Buccaneer Falls.\n\nThen we'll be sitting pretty, when it comes to food stores, at least.
Recover Stolen Spices from Buccaneer Creek and Buccaneer Falls and bring them to Barkeep Cormack in the Windsward Settlement.
The Bear of Scratchrock
"What's the situation?"
That bear I mentioned? He's mauled several villagers lately - the kind of death people rarely return from.\n\nI thought these weren't my problems, but now, I wonder.
"You want me to hunt down the bear?"

Exactly, though you might want to bring a few friends.\n\nI don't know where his lair is, so you'll have to track him down. I guess that means looking for whatever remains of his latest victim… Try looking near the lake.
Travel to {POITags}
Locate the remains of the bear's latest victim
Follow the trail of blood and cloth
Enter the Burrow and Kill {targetName}
Well now, someone's gone and shown me up. Hunting down that bear was no small thing.\n\nReally seems to have brought some relief to people here. I guess that's something for me to consider.
Seems reasonable that you're a bit scared... That's why I'm pointing you down there, and not going myself!
Bring down the bear of Scratchrock Burrow. Talk to Survivalist Karsattin in the Windsward Settlement when the task is complete.
Corrupted Sludge
"That's alright. What do you need?"

Harplass Homestead has just recently been Corrupted... likely spread from the west.\n\nI'm told the Corrupted there are covered in some kind of sludge. Again, get me samples, and we'll see what we can learn.
Travel to Harplass Homestead to acquire the Sludge of Corruption
Collect {itemName} from {targetName} Corrupted
This will be my first opportunity to study the... whatever it may be... in person! I'll admit, I have been a bit jealous of my colleagues who have had opportunities to interact with it up close.

Assist with further research by collecting samples of the Sludge of Corruption from the Plainsblot Corrupted at Harplass Homestead. Talk to Artificer Cotheran in the Windsward Settlement when the task is complete.
Back so soon, are you? Or maybe it was longer? I'm not sure… I've been distracted.\n\nYou won't believe what I've learned from these soil samples.
"What have you learned?"
As you so casually suggested, it's the differences - the soil from the Withered location actually repels the soil from the Corrupted location!\n\nHere, I'll take that sludge to further my studies.
Making Sparks
"What was he talking about?"
Not sure exactly. I mean he's always mumbling about something.\n\nBut it sounded like he wants to make some kinda explosives to fight Corruption.
"Should I ask him about it?"

You could, but I dunno, I was thinking of surprising him, making him some tinderboxes.\n\nIf you can get me the materials, I can do the rest. I mean, if there's a way for me to contribute, I should do it, right?
Gather {itemName}s from Flint
Gather {itemName}s from Bulrushes near the lake
Collect {itemName}s from {targetName} Withered near {POITags}
Flint Spalls, Bulrush Heads, and Steel Strikers, that's what I need. It shouldn't be too difficult to find everything.
Obtain Flint Spalls, Bulrush Heads, and Steel Strikers for tinderboxes. Talk to Survivalist Karsattin in the Windsward Settlement when the task is complete.
Look here, you got everything? Alright then, I guess it's all on me now.\n\nIt's a funny feeling, trying to do someone a favor. Kinda makes me feel like a kid again, and that was a LONG time ago.
Azoth Fulminate
"A new type of weapon?"
A fulminate! Not of mercury or gold, but of azoth! Highly volatile, and packing quite a punch.\n\nFor those untrained in the alchemical arts, you would know it better as a type of explosive.
"Interesting! How can I help?"
I have created a number of these devices, but they require testing.\n\nIf I give these to you, can you return to Harplass Homestead and detonate them? I need to know their impact on the Corruption.
Return to {POITags} to place Prototype Azoth Bombs
Place the Prototype Azoth Bombs

While this fulminate is difficult to make, if these bombs are successful, it may be a powerful new weapon in our arsenal. \n\nImagine explosions of azoth bringing down the largest Corrupted structures!
Test the prototype azoth bombs against the Corrupted sludge in Harplass Homestead. Talk to Artificer Cotheran in the Windsward Settlement when the task is complete.
Ha! I saw the smoke rising in the west and I knew you were successful.\n\nTell me, how well did they work? Did they destroy that Corrupted sludge?
"Damaged, not destroyed."
That muck is more resilient than I expected - I'll have to rework the fomula, but the results are promising.\n\nThank you for risking yourself in this test. I'll make sure to note your contribution!
The Fabric Negotiations
"You want to trade with them?"

It's worth a try. Constable Saville in Monarch's Bluffs has rebuffed our overtures, but Magistrate Bixford might listen.\n\nTake this message to Bixford asking to trade textiles for food. Good luck. We need it.
Hm, Hello. What have we here, a message from our friendly neighbors from Windsward?\n\nOf course, they'll be wanting something, won't they? What's it to be now? Food supplies, of course.
"They're offering textiles in trade."

Well, it's true that we are facing a slight shortage in clothing, but Constable Saville is not so keen on Windsward.\n\nPerhaps there is a subtle way to arrange things… yes, I will reach out to Magistrate Korrapati when I can.
Let's hope that Magistrate Bixford is more reasonable than Constable Saville.
Travel to the Monarchs Bluffs and speak with Magistrate Bixford about trading textiles for food to address the shortage in Windsward.
In Windsward:
In Everfall:
The Stevens Expedition
"What's the problem?"

Our shortage of metals for weapons and armor. I know Cotheran has other ideas, but we can't be fools here.\n\nEverfall is the only nearby settlement remaining that might have metals, but I begin to lose hope.
"I can talk to Everfall."
There is one thing we might try. Long ago, an expedition from Everfall disappeared while investigating the obelisks to the north. \n\nI know Constable Maecia blames herself…
Investigate {POITags} and search for any sign of the missing expedition
Continue your investigation in {POITags}
Search for the 'Day Twenty Six' journal entry at Cygnus
Search for the 'Day Twenty One' journal entry at Delphinus
Search for the 'Days Nineteen and Twenty' entry at Octans
Search for the {itemName} at {POITags}
Search for the {itemName} at {POITags}
Search for the 'Day One' journal entry at Orion
I have no idea what might have happened to that expedition, but Constable Maecia blaming herself is nonsense.\n\nIf you can learn what happened, it might bring her peace.
Investigate the Ancient Lookouts and retrace the steps of the Stevens expedition, and then talk to Constable Maecia in the Everfall Settlement.
Oh dear, you startled me! Wait, what? You have news of the Stevens Expedition?\n\nLet me see… oh no, you mean those poor souls actually perished out there?
"And it wasn't your fault."

It wasn't then, was it? I suppose that's a relief. I've carried that burden many years.\n\nYou've come from Windsward then? Tell me, how are the fine people over there faring in these difficult times?
"They have a shortage of metals."

A shortage of metals? Then why didn't Dauti reach out? Including you coming today, he's done our settlement many a good turn!\n\nWe'll certainly repay the favor. Tell Dauti I'll send him a shipment of ore soon as I can!
Happy Returns
Return to the Windsward Settlement and inform Constable Dauti that Everfall will be sending a shipment of ore.
[BLANK]
[BLANK]
Haha! {playerName}! You've returned from Everfall with great tidings, I presume?\n\nPlease tell me I'm not wrong. I'm trying to stay positive here, despite the circumstances.
"Everfall is sending ore."

Really? Well, I'll be a thrice-damned fool for ever doubting!\n\nYOU, my friend - you are the hero of Windsward, my favored warrior, my chosen envoy… every title I can heap upon you. Drinks in the tavern later - on me!
Towering Tools
"What collection?"

Oh, well, I am an Antiquarian. Yelena Pajitnova. Nice to... meet you. \n\nI collect tools used by the Ancients - construction tools - whatever they used to build these magificent towers. Only, I've met some resistance.
"I can help if you like."
Oh, would you? Those Guardians are... well... pesky. So I'd reward you handsomely.\n\nAny tools you can recover, I'm most interested in those two to the west. Oh, and thank you in advance!
This view is magnificent, isn't it? How they built such wonders is beyond me.\n\nIf you'll recover any tools you can find, I might have a better idea.
Collect any remaining tools of the Ancients from Fallswatch Overlook and Valley View Mirador, and return them to Antiquarian Pajitnova.
Investigate {POITags} for any remaining tools of the Ancients
You have a gleam in your eye... you've found something? Let me see!\n\nYes, these are precisely the types of things I'm looking for. The Ancients did not share our methods of construction at all.
Taken to Task
"What kind of labor?"

The kind you do with your hands. The funny thing is that we still don't even know what the Ancients look like.\n\nTwo hands? Four hands? No hands? But I believe it was not the Ancients themselves who did the work.
"Who did the work?"

It's not clear, but probably some type of thralls who served the Ancients.\n\nIn Amrine Temple, I've heard speak of an 'Ancient Taskmaster.' If you can defeat it and bring me a piece of it, that would be an interesting find.
Travel to Amrine Temple to locate the Taskmaster's Heart
Defeat {targetName} Guardians in {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} and collect {itemName} in {POITags}

Did you defeat the Taskmaster? Amazing! Let me see what you found…\n\nYes, the very heart of this being, clearly not biological, but was he once human? This is the perfect addition to my collection! Thank you!
Whatever elements you can recover from the corpse of the Taskmaster would be of greatest interest to me.
Defeat Moonshadow Guardians in Amrine Temple and Kisare the Taskmaster to acquire the Taskmaster's Heart. Report back to Antiquarian Pajitnova in Windsward.
No Mere Shot Across the Bow (Part 1)
"What did you have in mind?"

I say we blow the bastards up! Not only that, but I say we give 'em a taste of their own medicine.\n\nThey got some pretty fancy firearms too, and I think we could use those to upgrade our arsenal here.
"Alright. Count me in."
Perfect. The pirates' stronghold is east, led by that jerk, First Mate Misher.\n\nDefeat her crews, snag any musket parts and ammunition, and destroy what you can. Take down Misher herself, too.
Travel to the {POITags} and begin your assault on the pirate stronghold
Sabotage cannons throughout the stronghold
Collect {itemName} from the {POITags}
[BLANK]
You watch your back out there, partner.\n\nIf you can show those pirates what for, I'll see you well-rewarded.
Begin your assault on the Pirate Stronghold by stealing their Musket Parts and sabotaging their cannons
Set fire to the Striped Powderkegs throughout the stronghold
Collect {itemName} from {POITags}
[BLANK]
[BLANK]
Continue your assault on the Pirate Stronghold by stealing the Pirates' ammunition reserves and setting fire to their gunpowder.
No Mere Shot Across the Bow (Part 2)
[BLANK]
Defeat {targetName} at {POITags}
[BLANK]
Complete your assault on the Pirate Stronghold by defeating First Mate Misher and her pet alligator, Susanna. Talk to Barkeep Cormack at the Windsward Settlement when your foes are defeated.
No Mere Shot Across the Bow (Part 3)
[BLANK]

Gave 'em a good and bloody nose, did you? Ha! That'll teach them! Maybe bring us a spell of peace too.\n\nYou've gone and made my day, and now it's time to do right by you. Here, take this. You've earned it.
Of the Heart
"Should I go check on him?"

That might be for the best. I know he had hoped to spend this time in other pursuits.\n\nThere was a personal item he lost to the Guardians at Stoneview Seabreak. He may have missed his chance to reclaim it.
"I can recover that too."

You... you would do that? It would be most kind. Watcher Fayed... well, he is very special to me.\n\nIf you can recover the item he... er, we lost in Stoneview Seabrook... then bring it to Tahir at the beach.
Greetings again my friend! Didn't expect to see you back this way.\n\nAnd what is this? The jewelry box we lost in Stoneview Seabreak? How did you know?
"Magistrate Korrapati sent me."
Ah, of course. Deepti is worried for my fate, is she?\n\nI confess I have felt compelled to stay down here longer than I hoped. I promise though, I will come home soon.
If you can recover Watcher Fayed's personal items from the Seabreak, I know it will boost his spirits, especially if he must stay at the shoreline any longer.
Investigate Stoneview Seabreak and search for any personal items Watcher Fayed may have lost there.
Search for the missing personal items in Stoneview Seabreak
Retrieve a {itemName} from a {targetName}
Collect any Personal Items from Stoneview Seabreak
Pescando com o Shields
Colete a Isca de Bicho-de-conta ao coletar arbustos para o Mestre de Pesca Shields. Fale com o Mestra de Pesca Shields em Guardaventos.
“Olá, eu sou {playerName}.”
Olá, {playerName}! Antes de partir para a aventura e a glória, você precisará aprender a encher sua barriga com a generosidade do mar. \n\nPrimeiro, precisa de uma isca.
“Onde consigo isca?”
Uma das iscas mais acessíveis é o Bicho-de-conta, criaturas rastejantes que moram dentro de arbustos. O resto você pode conseguir de diversas outras maneiras.
Já encontrou algum Bicho-de-conta? Se você procurar nos restos lascados dos arbustos que coletou, deve achar alguns desses insetos. Volte quando tiver cinco deles.
Bichos-de-conta atraem peixes maiores e, acredite, o tamanho é importante. Além disso, ainda há mais alguns princípios básicos que quero comunicar a você, comandante.
Colete arbustos para conseguir {itemName}
Princípios Básicos da Pesca
Lance a isca, fisgue e puxe três peixes para o Mestre de Pesca Shields e entregue-os à Mestra de Pesca Ruby em Queda Eterna.
“O que devo fazer em seguida?”

Vamos entrar em ação agora! A pesca envolve três etapas básicas: lançar a isca, fisgar o peixe e puxar o animal. Pode levar algum tempo para se acostumar, mas depois que entrar no ritmo, vai conseguir continuar por horas sem parar.
“O que devo fazer depois disso?”
Se conseguir pegar três peixes, leve-os à Ruby em Queda Eterna e mostre a ela o que o velho Shields te ensinou.
A Mestra de Pesca Ruby em Queda Eterna vai gostar de treinar alguém novo.\n\n Ela é bem ávida e tem muito talento natural.
Você pescou esses peixes por conta própria? Shields acertou em mandar você para mim para continuar seu treinamento. Eu tenho muito a ensinar!
Equipe sua Vara de Pescar
Lance a isca com sua Vara de Pescar
Fisgue o peixe
Puxe o peixe
Fisgado

Pesque um Caramujo na Água Doce e um Molusco na Água Salgada, retire as partes úteis deles para usar como isca para a Mestra de Pesca Ruby e entregue-os à Mestra de Pesca Clemenson em Falésias do Monarca.
“Sim. O Mestre de Pesca Shields me mandou aqui.”

Na água doce, as iscas mais comuns que você consegue adquirir são caramujos, e na água do oceano, moluscos. \n\nA Mestra de Pesca Clemenson ficaria muito agradecida se esta isca de água salgada fosse entregue a ela.
“Por que estou pescando para um Mestre de Pesca?”
Não diga a ela que disse isto, mas ela tem tido problemas com a pescaria ultimamente.
A Mestra de Pesca Clemenson pode ser um pouco rude, mas eu a considero uma de minhas aliadas mais próximas nesta terra estranha.
Ruby mandou você fazer isso? Pff! Não sei por que ela pensa que preciso de ajuda...\n\nNão se ache muito só porque conseguiu uma isca.
Obtenha um Caramujo em Água Doce e retire as partes úteis para criar {itemName}
Obtenha um Molusco em Água Salgada e retire as partes úteis para criar {itemName}
Caça por um Local de Pesca
Pesque três vezes em um Local de Pesca para a Mestra de Pesca Clemenson e entregue um bilhete ao Mestre de Pesca Warwick nas Falésias do Monarca.
“O que pode me ensinar?”
Aqui vai uma lição: Você já viu um ponto na água que parece ideal para se pescar? São chamados de Locais de Pesca.\n\nTente a sua sorte nestes Locais de Pesca e depois pegue isto.
“O que é isto?”
É uma mensagem minha para o Mestre de Pesca Warwick. É fundamental que você não abra esta nota!

Está tendo problemas para encontrar Locais de Pesca? Olha ao longo da costa, ou em lagos e rios em terra firme. Os Locais de Pesca podem ser encontrados em qualquer tipo de água e em qualquer lugar.\n\nHá certos padrões que você pode perceber.
Uma nota da Mestra de Pesca Clemenson? Por favor, deixe-a aí. Minhas mãos estão muito sujas para tocar nela agora, mas... obrigado.
Pesque em Locais de Pesca (Ativos)
Prática Leva à Perfeição
Pesque quinze peixes em qualquer lugar para o Mestre de Pesca Warwick e entregue-os à Mestra de Pesca Perchal em Ilhéus do Sabre.
“Tenho algo para você.”
O melhor treino é o duro e focado. Você pescou algumas iscas e algumas poucas amostras de peixes, mas eu quero que se comprometa totalmente a pescar quinze peixes.
“O que eu faço com todos esses peixes?”
A Mestra de Pesca Perchal se distrai facilmente e se esquece de comer. Leve seus peixes para ela e ficará grata.
Não desista agora, recruta! Hã, digo, aprendiz!\n\nPesque quinze peixes para a Mestra de Pesca Perchal. Ela precisa comer!
Arrá! Você viu aquilo? Acabei de pescar o meu maior!\n\n... O que é isso? Ah, peixe em rações? Estou com um pouco de fome.
Pesque em qualquer lugar
Os Gigantes
Pegue oito peixes com mais de 20 polegadas de comprimento para a Mestra de Pesca Perchal e entregue-os à Mestra de Pesca Park no Bosque Reluzente.
“Como a pesca e a alquimia se misturam?”

A isca, é claro! Qual foi o maior peixe que você pescou até o momento? \n\nPesque 8 peixes com mais de 20 polegadas de comprimento e leve-os à Mestra de Pesca Park no Bosque Reluzente. Ela é uma pescadora, mas também é alquimista, e tem feito experiências com novos tipos de iscas.
“Novos tipos de isca?”
Sim, ela está pesquisando qual isca pode fisgar os peixes mais compridos, então lembre-se de dizer a ela o que você usou!

Lembre-se de que Moluscos e Ostras em água doce e Caramujos e Peixes-elétricos em água salgada aumentam a probabilidade de pescar peixes maiores.\n\nQualquer coisa maior que 20 polegadas vai servir para a Mestra de Pesca Park e a pesquisa dela.

Multiplique por três, carregue o um... Uou!\n\nO que é isso aí com você? Que espécime! Tenho estudado o comprimento dos peixes em relação ao peso e este se encaixa perfeitamente nas minhas descobertas.
Pesque 8 peixes com comprimento superior a 20 polegadas
Reagentes de Pesca
Colete uma Tinta de Lula e um Bigode de Bagre depois de retirar as partes úteis da Lula e do Bagre para a Mestra de Pesca Park e entregue-os à Mestra de Pesca Agarwal no Pântano do Tecelão.
“Pode me ensinar sobre pesca e alquimia?”

Vários peixes possuem partes úteis que, quando devidamente retiradas, podem ser utilizadas na Alquimia.\n\nPrincipalmente os bigodes do Bagre e a tinta da Lula. Você poderia coletar um pouco disso e entregar para Agarwal no Pântano do Tecelão?
“Por que ela precisa deles?”
Tudo nesta ilha vibra com o poder do Azoth, incluindo os peixes.\n\nAproveitar todas as partes das criaturas aquáticas é consciente e pragmático.
A alquimia em Aeternum é uma ciência delicada que depende frequentemente de reagentes elementares. \n\nA pesca pode ajudar a consegui-los.
Uma nova maneira de retirar partes úteis de Bagres e Lulas? Ora, esta é uma notícia brilhante! Obrigada por vir até aqui para me informar sobre as descobertas da Park.
Pesque uma Lula
Pesque um Bagre
Retire as partes úteis de uma Lula para obter {itemName}
Retire as partes úteis de um Bagre para obter {itemName}
Fio da Vida
Pesque três Botas no Pântano do Tecelão para limpar as águas para a Mestra de Pesca Agarwal e entregue uma nova linha para a Mestra de Pesca O'Connor na Costa Tempestuosa.
“Que tipo de peixe é abundante no Pântano?”
Muitas vezes sapatos são perdidos ao andar pelo pântano, se você pudesse pescar cinco botas, isso seria pelo menos um começo para ajudar a limpar a poluição na área.
“O que devo fazer quando terminar?”
Depois que ajudar a limpar o Pântano, vá ver a Mestra de Pesca O'Connor. É uma pessoa alegre e provavelmente terá uma tarefa maior para você.
Tire cinco botas da água, daí vá visitar a Mestre de Pesca O'Connor. Boa sorte!
Amo pescar mais do que eu amo lutar hoje em dia, embora ainda lute um pouco.
Pesque Botas no Pântano do Tecelão
Armas do Mar
Pesque uma Espada de Peixe e um Martelo de Cabeça de Peixe para Mestre de Pesca O'Connor e entregue-os ao Mestre de Pesca Abebe no Vale das Lamentações.
“Agarwal disse que você tinha algo para mim.”

A Espada de Peixe e o Martelo de Cabeça de Peixe são parte do folclore local… Dizem que se perderam nessas águas há muito tempo.\n\nNão há dúvidas de que são raridades. Tão raras que o Mestre de Pesca Abebe não acredita em mim quando digo que elas estão por aí esperando por uma mão que as empunhem mais uma vez.
“Por que ele não acredita em você?”
Posso ter destruído minha credibilidade falando de monstros marinhos na Costa Tempestuosa. \n\nMas mantenho a minha palavra: eu vi o monstro marinho e acredito na existência dessas armas.

Embora talvez não sejam as armas mais poderosas, a Espada de Peixe e o Martelo de Cabeça de Peixe são ótimos para iniciar uma conversa! “Onde você conseguiu essa arma náutica?”, as pessoas vão perguntar, e você pode responder: “Eu mesmo pesquei!”
Salve, colega. Imagino que O'Connor tenha enviado você para resolver outra de nossas disputas... Por Júpiter! Armas de verdade pescadas da água!
Pesque uma {itemName}
Pesque um {itemName}
Tesouros das Profundezas
Pesque um Baú do Tesouro para o Mestre de Pesca Abebe e entregue-o à Mestra de Pesca Klaus na Grande Fenda.
“O que pode me ensinar?”
Nesta terra onde as chuvas são eternas, existem muitas oportunidades para a pesca. No entanto, há algo de maior valor do que os próprios peixes à espreita nas profundezas: baús do tesouro.
“O que tem nesses baús?”
Moedas, joias e todos os tipos de artefatos preciosos.\n\nLeve o que achar à Mestra de Pesca Klaus na Grande Fenda para lembrá-la de que a vida não se resume a ajudar os Guardas Espirituais.
Tesouro é bom, mas acredito que são as propriedades transformadoras do Azoth daqui que tornam os peixes de Aeternum mais inteligentes.

Olá. Mestra de Pesca Klaus à sua disposição. É preciso ser forte para enfrentar os peixes dessa região.\n\nEles aprendem a lutar nessas águas frias da montanha. Tudo pode acontecer, por isso é bom se preparar.
Pesque um Baú do Tesouro
Rações para Guardas Espirituais
Pegue cinco peixes que pesem mais de 30 libras para a Mestra de Pesca Klaus e entregue-os ao Mestre de Pesca Davies em Bosque do Éden.
“Ele está indo bem.”

Os Guardas Espirituais são tremendos comilões e precisam de peixes grandes para suprir suas rações.\n\nVocê poderia pegar cinco peixes grandes e entregá-los ao Mestre de Pesca Davies? Ambos supervisionamos o abastecimento de alimentos para os Guardas Espirituais.
“Por que fornecer comida aos Guardas Espirituais?”

Você também ficaria com fome se estivesse lutando contra a Corrupção como eles. Mesmo que não precisemos de comida para sobreviver nesta ilha, certamente é uma maneira de não enlouquecer e perder a noção do tempo.
Eu marco meus dias com três refeições, principalmente peixes, claro.\n\nMe ajuda a ficar a par da passagem do tempo.
Sim, isso mesmo... Venham para o Papai, peixinhos... Opa! Quase não vi você aí. Cantar enquanto pesco me acalma.\n\nVocê trouxe um baita estoque de comida para os nossos Guardas Espirituais famintos.
Pesque um {itemName}
Peixe com Toque de Azoth
Pesque um Peixe com Toque de Azoth em Montanha Arruinada e entregue-o ao Mestre de Pesca Bernard.
“O que mais há na água além dos peixes?”
Também temos criaturas míticas, como o Peixe com Toque de Azoth.
“O que é um Peixe com Toque de Azoth?”
Um peixe cuja essência inteira foi possuída e dominada pelos poderes mágicos do Azoth, é claro! Pesque um para Bernard em Montanha Arruinada.
Não perca o ânimo se ainda não conseguiu pegar um Peixe com Toque de Azoth. Esses danados são lisos e rápidos, no mínimo.
Ah, presumo que seja a pessoa interessada em pesca que Davies enviou, certo? Que peixe estranho você tem aí.
Pesque um peixe com peso superior a 30 libras
Peixe com Toque de Corrupção
Pegue um Peixe com Toque de Corrupção na Montanha Arruinada e leve-o ao Mestre de Pesca Chang em Crosta de Ébano.
“Olá, Bernard. Precisa de mais alguma coisa?”
Sim. Quero que me ajude a provar algo aos meus colegas Mestres de Pesca.\n\nAssim como as terras daqui, as águas estão contaminadas pela Corrupção. Creio que os peixes também estejam.
“Isso é como um Peixe com Toque de Azoth?”
É, acho que sim. Observação interessante. Mas sim, pesque um Peixe com Toque de Corrupção e leve-o ao Mestre de Pesca Chang em Crosta de Ébano. É provável que a mesma situação se repita lá.
Se a Corrupção se infiltrar montanha abaixo e nos assentamentos do sul, todos os peixes de Aeternum serão afetados.
O que é isso que você traz, viajante? Isso cheira a Corrupção... Misericórdia, isso é para ser um peixe?\n\nO Mestre de Pesca Bernard estava certo em mandar você para mim.
Pesque um {itemName}
Relatório Ecológico
Obtenha filés de peixe de vários níveis de contaminação para o Mestre de Pesca Chang em Crosta de Ébano avaliar a saúde da população subaquática da ilha.
“Como são os peixes nesta área?”

Quero estudar os peixes de outras áreas para garantir que não tenham sido afetados como o que você trouxe de Montanha Arruinada.\n\nMe ajude e eu lhe recomendarei ao Grande Mestre de Pesca, Gaspar Machera.
“O que faz dele o Grande Mestre?”

Machera consegue pegar um peixe de mãos atadas e olhos vendados. Dizem que ele nem precisa de vara de pescar. Temos todos que tentar chegar ao nível dele.\n\nPesque e faça filés de peixe até ter o suficiente para mim.
Temos que analisar os peixes da ilha para verificar os níveis de Corrupção. E depois reportar ao Grande Mestre.

Saudações, jovem. As marés me falaram de sua chegada. Você carrega peixes de todas as áreas, certo? É, esses não estão contaminados. Ótimo...\n\nVocê já cresceu bastante, pequeno girino. Chegou a hora de ver se você consegue nadar com os grandes.
Obtenha {itemName}
Obtenha {itemName}
Obtenha {itemName}
Obtenha {itemName}
Para ser um Grande Mestre
Alcance o Nível 100 de Pesca e fale com o Grande Mestre Machera em Águas Fétidas.
“Olá, Grande Mestre.”

Você deve aprender a pensar como um peixe se quiser pescar peixes maiores e espécies lendárias. Ao meu lado, tenho uma lista dos peixes lendários que você pode conhecer em Aeternum.\n\nAlcance seu pico de maestria e retorne.
“Como eu alcanço meu ‘pico de maestria’?”
Escute os peixes. Ouça o que eles têm a dizer e entenda o que a água responde... Mais realisticamente, você deve praticar.
Você ainda não entrou em sintonia com os peixes. Continue treinando, meu peixinho, e você será recompensado por seus esforços.

Por fim, você se tornou um só com os peixes.

Você conquistou o título de Mestre de Pesca e o respeito de todos os pescadores de Aeternum.

Vá em frente, pesque e fique bem, camarada.
Alcance o Nível 100 na Habilidade de Pesca
Aventure-se em {POITags}
Derrote {targetName}
Colete {itemName}
Vendo Claramente (Expedição)
Colete a Lente do Antiquário de Simon Grey na Escavação de Amrine para a Antiquária Pajitnova em Guardaventos.
“De quem você está falando?”

Simon. Simon Grey, um dos pesquisadores mais brilhantes de Aeternum.\n\nEle desapareceu há muito tempo, na Escavação de Amrine. É triste tanto do ponto de vista pessoal quanto profissional. E pela perda de seu equipamento também.
“Equipamento?”

Sim. Simon tinha a lendária “Lente do Antiquário”, que possibilitava seu usuário inspecionar até o menor dos detalhes. \n\nNa verdade, se você conseguir encontrar tal item na Escavação, eu te recompensarei generosamente.

Você deve achar que sou insensível por estar querendo a Lente do Simon, mas meu luto pela morte de Simon já se foi.\n\nE se ele não precisa mais da Lente, ela deve ficar com alguém que precisa, como eu.

É verdade então? Simon Grey se tornou um Perdido, sua alma está fora do alcance da salvação. Muito triste.\n\nA pesquisa dele era inovadora, e usarei a Lente do Antiquário para honrar seu legado. Obrigada.
Ossos para Auquimedes (Expedição)
Auquimedes, o cachorro de Simon Grey, aguarda o retorno de seu mestre e está com muita fome. Parece que ele gostaria de ter uns ossinhos de Devastador para roer.
“O que foi, garoto?”
Sniff, sniff… Au-au! (Auquimedes parece estar com fome.)
“Você quer alguns ossos, garoto?”
Au-au! (Auquimedes parece satisfeito com o que você está oferecendo.)
(Auquimedes está ofegante e ansioso, esperando pelos ossos.)
Au! (Auquimedes pega os ossos com vigor e... prontamente os enterra.)
Aventure-se na Expedição da Escavação de Amrine
Derrote {targetName} para obter {itemName} para Auquimedes
Mais Ossos para Auquimedes (Expedição)
Auquimedes, o cachorro de Simon Grey, quer sentir o gosto de roer os Ossos Encantados da expedição do Obelisco Despedaçado.
“Ei, garoto, quer uns ossos especiais?”
Au-au! (Auquimedes arregala os olhos de desejo, e seu rabo mexe de um lado para o outro.)
“Os ossos dos Túmulos de Pedra Estelar devem servir.”
(Auquimedes solta um uivo cheio de empolgação.)
(Auquimedes está ofegante e ansioso, esperando pelos ossos especiais.)
Au-au! (Auquimedes rói os ossos com voracidade.)
